body.p:
Hodgenville Ky
Sept 13th 1864
Honl. T. E. Bramlette
Govr of Ky.
D Sir

Permit me to suggest to you that, at our augt election (last Mr. A. H. Redmon was duly elected and commissioned by you to fill the office of Justice for this No 1 District and that he declines being qualified. I would recommend to your Honor. John B. Cates. Esqr. as worthy and loyal citizen, a gentleman who has served for several years. (41 as such. He told me if he was appointed he would serve. We have none yet in this District -- Mr. Kirkpatrick will accept. As he has been commissioned.

very respectfully
H. S. Johnson
County Judge

Larue Co
Justice Peace
apptd
J B Cates
15 Sept/64
